page.title: 09EDUCATION
page.content: THERE IS A SMALL PRIMARY SCHOOL IN THE VILLAGE OF KENN.THIS SCHOOL TAKES CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES OF 5 AND 10. IT IS SITUATED IN A VICTORIAN BUILDING MAINTAINED BY THE DEVON COUNTY COUNCIL. IT WAS ORIGINALLY SET UP BY THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND THIS CAN BE SEEN FROM THE SIGN OUTSIDE THE SCHOOL. AFTER THE AGE OF 11 CHILDREN ATTEND SECONDARY SCHOOL EITHER IN DAWLISH OR EXETER TRAVELLING THERE EITHER BY CAR OR BUS. FURTHER EDUCATION AFTER THE AGE OF 16 IS CARRIED OUT IN EXETER AT A LARGE COLLEGE.THE VILLAGES ARE SERVED BY THE TRAVELLING LIBRARY SERVICE OF DEVON COUNTY COUNCIL BRINGING THEM A VARIETY OF READING MATERIAL TO CHOOSE FROM.USE IS MADE BY THE SCHOOL OF TELEVISION PROGRAMMES TRANSMITTED BY THE BBC AND ITA FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.
